verses.verse: [A song of high degrees.] He is blessed whatsoeuer he be that feareth God: walking in his waies.
For thou shalt eate the labours of thine handes: thou shalt be happy, and [all] shall go well with thee.
Thy wyfe shalbe as a fruitfull vine: vpon the sides of thyne house. (128:4) Thy chyldren [shalbe] like oliue braunches: rounde about thy table.
(128:5) Beholde, for thus shall the man be blessed: that feareth God.
(128:6) God wyll blesse thee out of Sion: and thou shalt see Hierusalem in prosperitie all the dayes of thy lyfe.
(128:7) Yea thou shalt see thy chylders chyldren: and peace vpon Israel.
